subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: Box 13--the reject!?
author: Frank Sumption
full_text:
I think it was the echo box, instead of aluminum foil, I use soft steel from 
a computer box, and I made it a wave guide echo box.

With my latest attempt, I did not even put in an echo box, all there is 
jacks for for it, so I can experiment. It seems like the box has to be 
flexible so as conditions change, so can the set up.

Frank


>From: "Steve Hultay" <urkel23@...>
>Reply-To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
>To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: Box 13--the reject!?
>Date: Thu, 12 Jul 2007 11:07:01 -0000
>
>#13 is the coolest looking one i've seen so far, looks straight out
>of a 50's sci-fi movie.  I would maybe leave the plug on there too.
>They may be able to come through clearer with all that current
>running through it from the outlet.  It's as if they have more
>options, but nobody is really sure how evp works really.  They feed
>off energy and it just seems like you would have more current from a
>wall socket than a couple of batteries.
>
>-Steve H.
>
